name: Critical Race & Ethnicity Studies
long_desc: This course provides students with an introduction to key theories from Critical Race and Ethnic Studies. Topics include the origins of eighteenthcentury racial philosophy, concepts such as intersectionality, and how different fields of study examine the role of race in society. Readings may include Kimberl Crenshaw, Richard Dyer, Toni Morrison, bell hooks, Richard Delgado, and others.

custom_fields.goals: This course is designed to give graduate students a theoretical toolbox to take with them to their partiicular field of research.
custom_fields.key_topics: critical race studies, theory, gender, disability, sexuality, class, intersectionality
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Group notes project, conference paper presentation
custom_fields.relevance: This course is targeted at graduate students
custom_fields.learning_resources: Most readings will be available on Canvas
